page.title: 01LANDSCAPE SW OF BROMSGROVE.
page.content: The area to the SW of Bromsgrove is mostly rural in aspect,the land cover is largely of uncultivated grassland, but residential areas are increasing. The largest residential area is the estate of{Charford,}originally built to house the workers of{Garringtons, once the greatest source of employment in the town. These council houses are now being offered for sale to the tenants,offers which are accepted in most cases.{Stoke Prior}is a village 2 miles SSW of the town and has many small industries as well as the larger {Bayer(UK).}Once a 'salt' village, the old workers cottages have been replaced by modern housing estates. The two-carriageway{M5 motorway}is undergoing major widening alterations to accommodate the increasing traffic travelling between the south and the north of England.
